result.execSummary:
The defendant Anglus Leron Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anglus Leron Walker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anglus Leron Walker was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surchare, DNA surchare and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of probation or civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violent contact with victim.  Parties may not reside together without approval of agent. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
No drugs or alcohol.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfuly complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly compete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor;; his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
 
 AS TO COUNT #2 (without the repeater enhancer), The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 118 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with victim.  
   Parties may not reside together without approval of agent. 
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.  mld
PLEA HEARING

Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of COUNT #1.
  
 Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Repeater Enhancer on COUNT #2.  

 AS TO COUNT #2 (without the repeater enhancer): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-27-2014 at 8:30 am.   All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to count #2.  Case passed to afternoon for Plea Hearing.  mld

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Anglus Leron Walker not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  First Amended Information was filed by the State to add the charge of Count #2: Bail Jumping.  Upon the agreement of the parties, Preliminary Hearing will be conducted on the Jury Trial date of 7-23-2014, as to Count #2.  The State to email police reports to defense counsel.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing and Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-23-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Anglus Leron Walker not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Parties maintain the Jury Trial date of 7-23-2014 at 8:30 am, Branch 4. Upon the request of parties, Court adjourns matter for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 7-15-2014 at 8:30 am, to address the possible new charge of Bail Jumping.   mld

Attorney Douglas J Rebholz in court, defendant Anglus Leron Walker not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court vacates bench warrant.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Bail Motion by the State heard and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-8-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-23-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Anglus Leron Walker not in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court addressed the multiple gps violations received from Justice Point, dated 5-20-2014 and 5-22-2014.  

On 5-20-2014, the defendant contacted Justice Point and reported that he needed to go to the Emergency Room at St. Joseph's Hospital.  Justice Point instructed defendant to go directly to the hospital and to provide verification immediately in the morning.  Defendant never went to the Emegency Room and was located outside his home from 3:23 pm to 4:06 pm, and was at an approximate address of 2556 N. 35th Street, which is in the complete opposite direction of St. Luke's Hospital.  Upon contacting defendant, he reported that he decided not to go to the emergency room while he was enroute and turned back around.  Court vacates the following pending dates; the Final Pretrial Conference on 6-24-2014 at 8:30 am and the Jury Trial date of 7-21-2014 at 8:30 am, branch 4.   

On 5-22-2014, Justice Point received a strap tamper alert at 3:31 pm.  Justice Point attempted to reach defendant to investigate the tamper, and there was no answer.  Justice Point reached defendant's mother, Melinda Stokes who confirmed that defendant removed his device and went running.  On 5-22-2014, the clerk instructed Attorney Douglas Rebholz (via telehonics), that the court required both his appearance and the defendant before Branch 4 on the morning of 5-23-2014.     

Both defendant and defense counsel, having failed to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.   mld

Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in court with attorney Douglas J Rebholz.  Defendant Anglus Leron Walker in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Exhibit 1 marked for identification.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Alex Mantay.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery and two discs from the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Fretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-24-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-21-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
